TopicTitle: what version of the game did you download first?

Articles.Content: Played the 0.13 demo for a while, then bought the game in 0.15

0.08. Whippersnapers, with your "struts" and "Mun" and "planes".

(In all seriousness, I love how the community has grown over the last several years And new features rock!)
0.18.4 after my friend told me about it when we were studying last year's Academic Decathlon Science guides.

either 0.8 or 0.9

no Mun, no struts, no fuel lines

First version I downloaded was .13

Btw, it's nice to see there are peaks in the (statisticaly representative?) sales at key releases

Edited August 5, 2013 by grawl

I think I got the game at .19. Might've been .18. I got it on steam in April, right when that whole expansion misunderstanding took place and anyone who purchased the game before the end of april were guaranteed all future updates and expansions(if they even make paid expansions) for free.

I was holding off 'till career mode was implemented, but I do love me some free stuff, even if it's stuff that probably won't actually be made >.>

I experienced KSP without a SPH and runway or a Tracking Station. I also witnessed the discovery of Minmus.

Edited August 8, 2013 by ngianoplus
Back when I started there was no Mun, ASAS, Struts, Hell even no map view, You kids got it all today.

Back when I started there was no Mun, ASAS, Struts, Hell even no map view, You kids got it all today.

You Sir, are quite the old timer!

I think mine was .18, after I saw my first Scott Manley video, which convinced me this wasn't some kind of cartoony game, but a math-based game of orbital mechanics. Upon seeing this, I said, "TAKE MY MONEY!!!"
.18 demo as first download and quick after bought the .20
So I Want To Play 0.16, But I Cant Find A Download Like, Help Wanted.

Bad necro, but I started in 0.18.4

No rovers, no mining, no sub assemblies, old space center, no communications, science, career, had to have a command part as the root of a vessel, garbage aerodynamics model, no Gamedata file structure, ugly old space plane parts, 3.75m was considered big, sas had to be turned off in order to change attitude, there was more than one kind of sas, no fairings, no reentry heat/heat management, mun was flat as a board, the sun shined through the planets, roverdude wasn't even making mods yet, etc

11 hours ago, Gegb1912 said:

So I Want To Play 0.16, But I Cant Find A Download Like, Help Wanted.

It isn't possible to download it legally.

I started around .16 and played quite a bit until the patch that broke aerodynamics for me and made it to hard to play. Now I'm back and managed to mod it back close to what it was and having fun again on career mode. I think it's funny the guy above me called it a "garbage aerodynamics model." while it was unrealistic it was funner IMHO. I lost interest as its a game and supposed to be fun and will never be entirely real anyways. 

Edited January 23, 2018 by MaGicBush

31 minutes ago, MaGicBush said:

I started around .16 and played quite a bit until the patch that broke aerodynamics for me and made it to hard to play. Now I'm back and managed to mod it back close to what it was and having fun again on career mode. I think it's funny the guy above me called it a "garbage aerodynamics model." while it was unrealistic it was funner IMHO. I lost interest as its a game and supposed to be fun and will never be entirely real anyways. 

Harder how?  The old style aerodynamics made it so much harder to leave the soup-o-sphere.

1 hour ago, Corona688 said:

Harder how?  The old style aerodynamics made it so much harder to leave the soup-o-sphere.

Well I had a different experience, and found it easier to leave and reenter. I'm not the only one either. Google reveals a lot of other people who wanted it modded back. 

Edited January 23, 2018 by MaGicBush

2 hours ago, Corona688 said:

Harder how?  The old style aerodynamics made it so much harder to leave the soup-o-sphere.

I'm guessing "Harder because it's not the way I'm used to."

 

Oh, and 1.3 was my introduction. 

Edited January 23, 2018 by Geonovast
I bought it the very day .16 came out

.19. Not the oldest version. But I certainly got to ride the developmental train and it was a hell of a ride. I remember my first update- I got the Cupola module, the skipper engine, the command chair, and a few other things that I can't recall (I could cheat by looking at the changelog on the wiki, but I'm going based off of the memory of first using it).

The old "aero" was atrocious, within a couple of weeks I'd found whatever version of FAR was around then & was much happier.
